intro: Neoporteria carrizalensis var. totoralensis, commonly known as the Totoralensis neoporteria, is a rare plant species native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure and leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a unique coloration that aids in attracting pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
